column4: anyone help me with changing permissions on a mounted device?
Okay. I need to change permissions on a mounted device. Am I doing it properly with chmod?
trying to change permissions on mounted ipod
chmodding a fat32 is pointless because fat32 doesn't retain the permissions
you need to mount the entire drive with certain permissions
so what are you suggesting? And how do I go about that?
I can't write into my ipod as user.... I need to change that.
it should be mounted automatically with correct write permissions
so if it isn't then you might also have other issues with hal or something else
That's another thing. Plugging the ipod in wouldn't automatically mount. I received some privilege error. So I had to mount manually.

hmm I am not to big on hal myself even though I use it, I think it is pretty buggy. Basically go to that ubout link, you are probably going to want to mount the drive with the options fmask=111,dmask=000

hardware abstraction layer, it is sort of the standard thing that automounts drives and such, even though there are many utilities that can do that, all the DEs seem to just use hal so you pretty much have to use it
